intro: Bulbophyllum oreocharis, commonly known as the black orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. The plant is characterized by its dark, almost black, pseudobulbs and elongated leaves. Its flowers are usually small and greenish-white, with a unique, intricate structure. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
